column2:
ggplotly(
  ggplot(ipca, aes(x=date, y=value))+
    geom_line()+
    geom_line(aes(y=mean(ipca$value)),color="blue", size=.5)+
    geom_line(aes(y=mean(ipca$value)+sd(ipca$value)),color="red", size=.5)+
    geom_line(aes(y=mean(ipca$value)-sd(ipca$value)),color="red", size=.5)+
    geom_line(aes(y=mean(ipca$value)+2*sd(ipca$value)),color="red", size=.5)+
    geom_line(aes(y=mean(ipca$value)-2*sd(ipca$value)),color="red", size=.5)+
    geom_line(aes(y= ma(ipca$value, order=12)),color="green", size=.5)+
    labs(color="")+ xlab("Data")+ ylab("% a.m.")+    
    theme(legend.position = "bottom")+
    annotate("rect", 
             xmin = as.Date("2020-03-01", "%Y-%m-%d"), 
             xmax = as.Date("2021-06-01", "%Y-%m-%d"), 
             ymin=-Inf,  
             ymax=Inf, 
             fill="grey", 
             alpha=0.5)+
    theme(axis.text.x = element_text(size=10),
          axis.text.y = element_text(size=10),  
          axis.title.x = element_text(size=10),
          axis.title.y = element_text(size=10),
          legend.text = element_text(size=10))+
    xlim(as.Date(c("2000-01-01", "2020-12-01"), format="%Y-%m-%d"))+
    scale_color_stata()+
    theme_stata()+
    scale_x_date(breaks = ipca$date, date_breaks = "1 year", date_labels = "%Y-%b") + 
    theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, vjust = 0.5)) +
    labs(title='Índice nacional de preços ao consumidor - amplo (IPCA)',
         # subtitle='',
         caption='Dados: IPEADATA')
    # stat_smooth(
    #   color = "#FC4E07", fill = "#FC4E07",
    #   method = "loess"
    # )
)

Scale for 'x' is already present. Adding another scale for 'x', which will replace the
